repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Mount Vernon Seminary and College M Street Campus Collection

physdesc.extent: 8 document boxes, 1 slim document box, 2 flat boxes

did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: M Street was the second location of Mount Vernon Seminary, founded in Washington, D.C. in 1875. The school officially began operating from its M Street location in 1880. Mount Vernon Seminary and College merged with The George Washington University in 1999. This collection contains photographs, artifacts, school event and club records, student scrapbooks and other student materials created during the school's time on M Street. The materials range in date from circa 1877-1939.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: Photographs, Artifacts, Mount Vernon Seminary records, and Alumnae scrapbooks, correspondence, and diplomas.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In the summer of 1880, Mount Vernon Seminary moved from its first location on F Street to 1100 M Street. Elizabeth Somers originally purchased two adjoining mansions and converted them into school buildings. She added to the M Street houses by building new classrooms, a conservatory, music room, and chapel. Within the next few years, Somers purchased three additional houses and oversaw their complete renovation.
While located on M Street, Mount Vernon Seminary grew to more than 150 pupils. The Mount Vernon Alumnae Association formed in 1885 and held its first reunion in 1886 on the M Street campus.
In 1917, Mount Vernon Seminary moved to a new campus on Nebraska Ave.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs, artifacts, school records, student scrapbooks and othe student materials. The materials range in date from circa 1877-1939.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Collection acquired by GWU upon merger with Mount Vernon College. Collection transferred to Foggy Bottom campus in 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photographs in this series include student portraits, student candids, exterior and interior photos of campus, campus events, and off-campus outings. The series includes multiple cyanotypes of dorm rooms and the M Street chapel. The photographs range in date from circa 1877-1915.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains artifacts belonging to students of Mount Vernon Seminary as well as artifacts from the school itself including signs displaying school rules and a personal mirror/frame. The objects in this series range in date from circa 1880-1917.

did.unittitle: Mirror from the elevator rescued by Clara Hawkins Willett
Print block of Mrs. Somers, Mrs. Hensley, and Mrs Cole; stamp with shield

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from Mount Vernon Seminary, including campus event pamphlets, honor rolls, club meeting minutes, and two scrapbooks containing programs from special events and services. The materials in this series date from circa 1880-1939.
In order to keep all book plates together, one book plate from 1939 is included in this series.

did.unittitle: Laying of the cornerstone for the Nebraska Ave. campus records
The Order of the Lily, Bertha Vernell Bush

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains student-made scrapbooks, letters to and from Minnie Swormstedt (MVS class of 1882), a student's autograph book and diplomas of two Seminary students. The scrapbooks contain photographs of campus life at Mount Vernon Seminary, correspondence, programs from campus events, and other ephemera (including materials like magazine advertisements, newspaper headlines, chewing gum wrappers, and off campus event programs.) Many of the scrapbook pages contain written anecdotes from the owner. The autograph contains messages from friends and acquaintances. Some are written in elaborate calligraphy and intricately decorated. The materials in this series date from circa 1880-1914.

did.unittitle: Alma Schmidt scrapbook front and back covers
Diplomas, India Bell Veder Fleming (1906) and Jeroma Brooks Cartwright (1903)
